intro: Polygala chinensis var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy Chinese polygala, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine, soft hairs, contributing to its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. This species is valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
